caption: Beautiful quiet spot next to the relaxing pond, feed the ducks, sit, read. Savoir Vivre!
Beautiful area to take a walk.  The area behind the Bassin Octogonal is currently closed off for events (20/9/2024)
Nice place to sit and relax. Good stop for a snack

Good place.  Nice tourist place Big garden Open place for the kids In summer and in school vacancies there are some extra activities  Fashion design stool over there ( but only for professional people who are related in the fashion industry).  Public transport is easy.  Near museum Louvre.  Near river After all good place

Well to be honest I don‚Äôt know what makes this Bassin so special from any other bassin in public area, except for it‚Äôs located in the biggest square in the city center of Paris. As any other public area it‚Äôs always seems crowded, so many people sitting down there using the green chairs gazing round at the bassin which is a dirty pond. Otherwise I would more have beautiful views gazing towards the nearest Jardin Les Tuilleries, or just walking around the Seine river and any other historical sites nearby.
A nice and beautiful place to relax when it's sunny.

Very beautiful garden. There are details hidden everywhere in the vast garden. You can see that the garden is symmetrical, as is the arrangement of the statues. The trees on both sides are even pruned into special shapes. Walking in the garden, you can feel the luxury and pride of the royal family in the past.
A very calm place where you sit and relax until you get home. The garden around is very beautiful and you would like to sit and see things around.
Fountain inside the jardin des tuileries Quiet and beautiful
When walking through Paris, be sure to add this to your route. Also great place to sit and chat or even to read.
Amazing views around the basin and it was filled with ducks. Quite serene. I would wait to get a bench and enjoy the views. It is only a short walk from both the louvre and place de concorde obelisk.
If you're looking for peace and quiet in Paris this is the place. The park offers multiple opportunities to relax in the shade and the lake is like out of a Wes Anderson movie

Similar to the other pond in the Tuileries Garden, but octagonal and also appears to be a lot dirtier. However, it provides much better views of the Place de la Concorde (Ob√©lisque de Louxor) and the Arc de Triomphe than the other pond near the Louvre. It's a short walk to the obelisk but another 30-40 minute walk to the Arc de Triomphe.

No Christmas lights, closing at 19:00, workers yelling and you only get out from one entrance, needed to walk back 1 km for nothing.
A good garden for morning walk little bit busy in weekends but worth the visit
Great place to relax, chill, and enjoy the quiet.

The Tuileries Gardens, where the Olympiad of the Republic was conceived in 1793, played a part in Olympic history by hosting the epee tournament at the 1900 Games, where for the first time three medals of different colours were awarded, thus inspiring the principle of three medals for the top three finishers
During the dry season the park is horribly dry and after a nice stroll you end up like Pepa Pig in a dusty puddle

Pretty site, relaxing mood.
Nice public chairs. Too loud noice from the streets
Beautiful place for children to play.
It's a great place to relax, although there's a lot of trash around.
A beautiful fountain that is one of the highlights of these signatory gardens.
A small lake situated in the Jardin des Tuileries, there are loose chairs around it where you can sit to read a book or just relax. A good escape within the city.
Calm sceneries.
Definitely has 8 sides and slightly sunken - therefore fully deserves its 5 stars for accuracy of naming
